item.title: Family of missing UK teen say she was murdered in Hamas attack
item.description: Noiya Sharabi, 16, disappeared after Hamas attacked Kibbutz Be'eri, killing her mother and sister.

item.title: Gaza protest: Braverman to meet Met Police boss over London demonstration
item.description: The home secretary wants to know why certain chanting at a central London rally did not lead to arrests.

item.title: Modern slavery helpline used by UK care staff from overseas
item.description: Unscrupulous employers and agents are charging workers thousands to plug gap in social care.

item.title: Storm Babet flooding sees severe warnings as hundreds evacuate
item.description: Residents of 500 Nottinghamshire homes are among those told to move, as communities across the UK endure more flooding.

item.title: Labour fears no-fault eviction ban will be delayed
item.description: Ministers maintain a new law will be brought in but Labour says they fear it could be watered down.

item.title: Argentina votes in election rocked by radical candidate
item.description: An outspoken anti-establishment economist has put his two main rivals on the defensive in the campaign.

item.title: Pro-Israel protest in London calls for return of hostages
item.description: Demonstrators hold photos of Israelis held in Gaza since the 7 October Hamas attacks.

item.title: Belgians race boats made of giant pumpkins
item.description: Thrills and spills as kayakers use pumpkin power in a competition near the city of Antwerp.

item.title: Watch: Sheep invade front garden in Leicestershire
item.description: A homeowner in Leicestershire is left bemused as his Ring doorbell alerts him to the intruders.

item.title: Swansea: Ambulance waits 28 hours outside Morriston Hospital
item.description: The Welsh Ambulance Service declares an extraordinary incident due to delays handing over patients.

item.title: Iran says girl who collapsed on Tehran metro is ‘brain dead’
item.description: Activists say morality police assaulted her for not wearing a hijab, but officials say she fainted.

item.title: Detroit synagogue president Samantha Woll found murdered
item.description: Samantha Woll's body was found in a city park with stab wounds but she was probably killed at home.

item.title: United States Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton disqualified as Max Verstappen wins
item.description: Lewis Hamilton is disqualified from second place in the US Grand Prix after running Max Verstappen's Red Bull close for victory.

item.title: The Papers: Braverman 'fury' at demo chants, and Charlton tributes
item.description: Monday's papers carry the latest on tensions in the Middle East and more tributes to Sir Bobby Charlton.

item.title: How were the 39 people killed in the Essex lorry case identified?
item.description: How tattoos, fingerprints and hidden numbers helped identify the Essex lorry victims.

item.title: James Blunt on his 'made-up' memoir, Carrie Fisher and losing a child
item.description: The pop star is back with a new album and a semi-fictional memoir. But who is the real James Blunt?

item.title: Shirley Bassey means other black stars 'forgotten', say musicians
item.description: Recognition for black Welsh musicians hasn't been helped by having one very famous star, says rapper.

item.title: Prince's Diamonds and Pearls: An oral history
item.description: The story of Prince's biggest-selling album in the UK, told exclusively by the people who were there.

item.title: Rushdi Abualouf reports from Gaza camp where thousands live in tents
item.description: Around 2,000 families who've fled their homes are struggling to find water, food and medication.

item.title: Could the UK's tides help wean us off fossil fuels?
item.description: The UK has some of the world's most powerful tides - and is well placed to exploit their power.

item.title: Ukraine fears drone shortages due to China restrictions
item.description: Volunteers in Ukraine say it is harder to access Chinese-made drone parts after Beijing clamped down.

item.title: 'My business had £1.6m stolen in 20 minutes'
item.description: Kent Brushes, which makes hairbrushes for royalty, says it was tricked into giving thieves access to its account.

item.title: Matt Dawson: 'England must build new era' after SA defeat
item.description: England have a platform to try and force their way back into the game's elite, but they must not squander the progress made in France says Matt Dawson.

item.title: Mario v Sonic: Rivals launch similar games in same week
item.description: It is the first time for more than 30 years that the two rivals have released games in the same week.

item.title: Why Indonesia can’t stop crocodile attacks
item.description: The country sees the most crocodile attacks in the world - and the problem could get even worse.

item.title: Why Nigeria’s lax attitude to names is causing a fuss
item.description: Many Nigerians have different names on different documents - which can be problematic for politicians.

item.title: Kuda Bux: The Indian magician who charmed the West with his 'X-ray eyes'
item.description: Kuda Bux found fame after claiming he was able to read with his face covered like an Egyptian mummy.

item.title: Stampy's Lovely World: 1.7m say farewell to YouTube series
item.description: Joseph Garrett, better known as Minecraft's Stampy Cat, broadcasts his final episode in the series.

item.title: Mangrove forests: Steely gaze of young tigress wins photo award
item.description: The Mangrove Photography Awards show unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

item.title: Sir Patrick Stewart makes surprise Woodstock Bookshop visit
item.description: The actor dropped into The Woodstock Bookshop when he saw copies of his memoir in the window.

item.title: Autumn statement: Government considers help for first-time buyers
item.description: The Treasury is understood to be considering extending a low deposit mortgage scheme for a year.

item.title: Tax cuts will be considered if inflation falls, cabinet minister says
item.description: Robert Jenrick says PM Rishi Sunak has the "right priorities" despite his party's by-election losses.

item.title: South Africa's Bongi Mbonambi accused of racial slur in World Cup win over England
item.description: England flanker Tom Curry reported that South Africa hooker Bongi Mbonambi used a racial slur towards him during the Springboks' Rugby World Cup semi-final win.

item.title: Léopold Sédar Senghor: Senegal delays auction in France
item.description: Dakar wants to buy rings, watches and military decorations belonging to the nation's first president.

item.title: Search off Ramsgate for man reported overboard from cruise ship
item.description: Coastguard aircraft and RNLI lifeboats search for the crew member off the coast at Ramsgate.

item.title: Rishi Sunak submits plans for fence around country home after protest
item.description: The move follows a rooftop protest by Greenpeace activists earlier this year.

item.title: 'England’s greatest ever player' – football pays tribute to Sir Bobby Charlton
item.description: The world of football has united in tribute to Manchester United and England legend Sir Bobby Charlton, who died on Saturday.

item.title: Hollesley Bay: Three prisoners abscond in one day prompting search
item.description: Suffolk Police warn the public not to approach the men and contact officers if they see them.

item.title: Watch: Boats collide in South China Sea's disputed waters
item.description: The Philippines armed forces said their video showed a Chinese vessel colliding with a Philippine ship.

item.title: Cricket World Cup 2023: England's Reece Topley ruled out of tournament with broken finger
item.description: Bowler Reece Topley is ruled out of the rest of the World Cup with a broken finger, leaving England to ponder his replacement.

item.title: Premier Inn 'bedbug bites' case leads to compensation
item.description: Vicky Hills says the bites were "incredibly itchy, incredibly painful" and she needed antibiotics.

item.title: Pepper X: Eating world's hottest pepper was euphoric, says creator
item.description: Ed Currie describes eating peppers "all day long", and his record-breaking feat.

item.title: Courtney Lawes: England flanker to retire at end of World Cup
item.description: England vice-captain Courtney Lawes will retire from international duty at the conclusion of the Rugby World Cup.

item.title: Tyson Fury v Oleksandr Usyk & Anthony Joshua v Deontay Wilder could become double bill in April
item.description: The historic undisputed heavyweight fight between Tyson Fury and Oleksandr Usyk could become part of a superstar double bill, featuring Anthony Joshua's fight against Deontay Wilder.

item.title: Aston Villa 4-1 West Ham: Villa and Ollie Watkins 'transformed' under manager Unai Emery
item.description: How has Unai Emery turned around Aston Villa's fortunes and given them a chance of achieving "something really special" this season?

item.title: MOTD2 analysis: Ben Mee praises 'fantastic' Watkins and Diaby duo as Aston Villa defeat West Ham
item.description: Jermaine Jenas and Ben Mee analyse the new Aston Villa partnership of Ollie Watkins and Moussa Diaby.

item.title: ICC Cricket World Cup: Suryakumar run out by 'outrageous' New Zealand fielding
item.description: New Zealand's Mitch Santner and Trent Boult combine brilliantly to run out India batter Suryakumar Yadav during their World Cup match in Dharamsala.

item.title: England 22-18 Tonga: Hosts hold off dogged Pacific islanders to win Test series opener
item.description: England fight off an impressive Tonga side to win the first match of their three-Test series, Tom Johnstone scoring twice in the second period.

item.title: Vivianne Miedema return after 11 months 'special' for Arsenal - Katie McCabe
item.description: Arsenal's Katie McCabe calls Vivianne Miedema's return "special" after the striker makes her comeback following 11 months out through injury.

item.title: Hamas hostages: Families 'worried sick' for relatives held in Gaza
item.description: British-Israeli woman calls on the UK government to do "everything in its power" to secure their release.

item.title: Hamas hostages: Who are the people taken from Israel?
item.description: From elderly grandparents to young children, these are the people known to have been taken captive.

item.title: Rushdi Abualouf: My daughters beg for Gaza City return - but our old lives are over
item.description: The BBC's Rushdi Abualouf describes his family narrowly avoiding a drone attack - and being displaced four times in 15 days.

item.title: Iran warns Israel to stop war in Gaza or region will 'go out of control'
item.description: Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian also criticised the US for providing military support.

item.title: What is Hamas, and what’s happening in Israel and Gaza?
item.description: What is the background to the Palestinian militant group Hamas and its latest attack on Israel?

item.title: Israel Gaza war: History of the conflict explained
item.description: Tensions between Israel and the Palestinians date back decades, but what are the key issues?

item.title: Inside Jenin mosque destroyed in Israeli missile strike
item.description: Israel carried out an air strike on Sunday, saying Hamas was using a mosque as a 'terrorist compound'.

item.title: Israel-Gaza war: UN agencies call for Gaza ceasefire as aid arrives
item.description: A joint statement from Unicef, the World Food Programme and the WHO calls the situation "catastrophic".

item.title: Gaza neighbourhood flattened and hospital told to evacuate
item.description: Intensive Israeli air strikes continue as Hamas-run health ministry says death toll passes 4,300.

item.title: The forgotten Israeli hostages kept by Hamas in Gaza for years
item.description: Israel's pain over some 200 people kidnapped by Hamas overshadows the years of waiting for two hostages and soldiers' remains.

item.title: Hamas video shows US mother and daughter hostage release
item.description: Judith Raanan and her daughter Natalie had been abducted during Hamas's deadly raid on Israel.

item.title: Palestinians under attack as Israeli settler violence surges in the West Bank
item.description: Palestinian families say they have been intimidated and displaced in the wake of Hamas's attack on Israel.

item.title: Israeli Arabs arrested over Gaza social media posts
item.description: Influencer Dalal Abu Amneh is among those to be held in a crackdown on Gaza-linked content.

item.title: Judith and Natalie Raanan: Hamas frees two US hostages
item.description: Israel confirms they received Judith and Natalie Raanan from Hamas at the Gaza boundary on Friday evening.

item.title: BBC reports from inside destroyed Gaza neighbourhood
item.description: BBC Arabic's Adnan El-Bursh speaks to residents in a destroyed neighbourhood in Gaza.

item.title: Cairo Summit: Arab leaders reject forced displacement of Palestinians
item.description: Egypt hosts a peace summit in Cairo as the first aid convoy enters Gaza after two weeks of war.

item.title: Israel aims to cut Gaza ties after war with Hamas
item.description: Israel's defence minister says the country's long-term plan is to cut ties completely with Gaza.

item.title: US warship intercepts missiles fired from Yemen 'potentially towards Israel'
item.description: The USS Carney in the Red Sea downed missiles and drones fired "potentially towards targets in Israel".

item.title: Residents leave as tension grows at Israel-Lebanon border
item.description: Fears fighting could erupt between Hezbollah and Israel are seeing communities on both sides evacuate.

item.title: Gaza Strip in maps: What it's like for the people who live there
item.description: Find out more about what it is like to live in the Gaza Strip, from the economy to education, health and water.

item.title: Israeli community frozen as Hamas atrocities continue to emerge
item.description: Israeli communities are struggling as bodies continue to be found after Hamas attacked on 7 October.

item.title: The world is losing its humanity, UNRWA chief says
item.description: Gaza's war could spread and the region is on the "edge of an abyss", Philippe Lazzarini tells the BBC.

item.title: Gaza hospital: Breaking down video of Al-Ahli Arab hospital explosion
item.description: BBC Verify’s Merlyn Thomas examines video of the explosion.

item.title: Tributes for 'brave' British-Israeli father murdered in Hamas attack
item.description: Yonatan Rapoport was described as 'a lovely man' with a 'wonderful sense of humour'.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Joe Biden's search for a Middle East solution just got harder
item.description: After the destruction of the Al-Ahli hospital, hopes for an end to the war are even fainter.

item.title: Alex Danzig: Fears grow for much-loved historian kidnapped by Hamas
item.description: The abduction of Holocaust expert Alex Danzig has caused particular distress in Israel and Poland.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: Renting: What are your rights as a tenant?
item.description: With one in five people now renting in the UK, it's important to understand your rights as a tenant.
